sen.j: 平安時代、皇親である王氏をはじめ、源氏、藤原氏、橘氏などの氏長者は、同族内から毎年、氏爵により叙爵する者を推挙する権能を許されていた。
sen.e: In the Heian period, the chieftains of the Imperial family, the O clan, as well of the Minamoto, Fujiwara and Tachibana clans, were authorized to recommend grant of noble rank to members of their claims in the uji no shaku ceremony.

sen.j: しかし、橘氏が次第に衰退し、参議橘恒平を最後に公卿を輩出しなくなったこともあり、ついに氏爵の推挙は大納言橘澄清の女より生まれた藤原時姫（藤原兼家正室）所生の大納言藤原道隆に委ねられることとなった。
sen.e: However, the decline of the Tachibana clan led to Sangi (Councilor) TACHIBANA no Tsunehira becoming the last Tachibana to become kugyo (court noble) and the position delegated to Dainagon (Major Counselor) FUJIWARA no Michitaka, the son of FUJIWARA no Tokihime (the lawful wife of FUJIWARA no Kaneie) who is the daughter of Dainagon TASHIBANA no Sumikiyo.

sen.j: そして、この権能を担う者を是定という。
sen.e: The person to hold this position of authority is called the Zejo, who since this point in time was granted this title under imperial decree given to uji no in, based on recommendation by the Tachibana clan of nobles belonging to the Fujiwara and Minamoto clans related to the Imperial family.

sen.j: 以来、橘氏の外戚にある藤原氏や源氏の公卿が橘氏の推挙に基づき、天皇の宣旨を氏院に賜り、是定となった。

sen.j: この称号は王氏即ち皇族の間でも存在し、第一親王、後に諸王の中から選出された長者が諸王を代表して是定となったが、平安時代以降、諸王の数が減少すると、神祇伯の家系に移り、一旦、第一親王の手に委ねられるも、再び神祇伯の家系に継承されることとなった。
sen.e: This title was used also within the imperial O clan, granted to the first Imperial Prince or Princess and later to choja (chieftain of the family) selected from the Shoo (princes without proclamation as imperial princes) but moving to the Jingihaku (administrators of religious affairs) with the drop in the number of Shoo after the Heian Period, inheriting the post over generations despite temporary restoration of the title to the Imperial Princes.
